channel.title: Quick question about sprites
channel.description: ok so im working on making some new items for my server...and i was wondering what i must do to make a new sprite for the item in inventory?

item.title: Quick question about sprites
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

@Meatstick: Yeah, if can you fully explain how you’re getting it to save your adjustments via the interface, please?

To be honest, it’s not a big issue, as it works perfectly fine altering the java file. However, it would be good to know for future reference.

So, if you have the spare time, it’d be greatly appreciated if you could explain how you’re getting it to work.

Regards,

Yong-Min

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about sprites
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“meatstick, post:7, topic:274554”][quote author=yong min link=topic=362733.msg2756712#msg2756712 date=1240254300]

That’s a false statement, sir. You can use the interface to change that, you just have to know how.

Oh, ok. Well if it is in fact a false statement, then I do apologise. However, every possible way just didn’t save the new height and width when modified within the interface.
[/quote]
Works for me, all i have to do is to save it to whatever i want, however i have to add a .spr when i save it. You can check if it works by openining the sprite again and it should automaticlly set the values that you chose in the fields.[/quote]

That isn’t working for me eather, but i would want to know if you doing something specielt to it?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about sprites
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Create an image and save it as a .png, and then load it in your sprite editor and save it as .spr (find the number when you unpack your Sprites.rscd file). The numbers must be corresponding. Once you’ve done that, add the .spr file into your sprites folder (in your sprite editor folder), and then pack it.

Once packed, make the new item in the ItemsDef.xml file and for the sprite, take the and minus 2150 from it to determine the inventory image. This will also need to be added into the Items.rscd file too.

If you need anymore help, please don’t hesitate to ask

Regards,

Yong-Min

[edit] When trying to change the height and width on the editor interface, it won’t work. You will simply have to add the information you want to change in the Sprites.java file. You want to be looking at:

private boolean requiresShift  = true;/false;
private int xShift = 0;
private int yShift = 0;
private int width2 = 0;
private int height2 = 0;

Read full topic
